intro: Calpigyne frutescens, commonly known as the African bluebell, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a shrub that typically grows to a height of about 1 to 2 meters, featuring slender, often branched stems. The plant produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to purple, which bloom in late summer. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and have a slightly hairy texture. Calpigyne frutescens is adapted to dry conditions and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
